<h1>RSA intro</h1>

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ee38c70e-a210-4d2c-b769-2bf904ee2908)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ff71df9a-af9d-4897-a6f1-73586300a318)

<h2>Solution: </h2>

<h3>Step 1:</h3>

As we can see we have the ```N-value (Modulus)``` , ```C-value (cipher text)``` ```and E-value (Exponent)```

So let's try to get the ```P``` and ```Q``` by factorize the big N-value, by using [FactorDB](https://factordb.com/).

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/80ea4b56-d5e5-4f0f-978f-7e3f148125ed)

<h3>Step 2:</h3>

Let's write a code:
```
from Crypto.Util.number import *

N = 
p = 
q = 5054843

e = 65537
c = 

phi = (p - 1) * (q - 1)
d = inverse(e, phi)

m = pow(c, d, N)

hex_str = hex(m)[2:]
result = bytes.fromhex(hex_str).decode()

print(result)

//ectf{b4sic_F4cT0rDb_rS4}
```

<h2>The flag:</h2>

```ectf{b4sic_F4cT0rDb_rS4}```
